Help: Start a new session
DetailedHelp: Start a Fishbowl session. You cannot be in multiple sessions at once.

Help: Join Session #`ID`
DetailedHelp: Join Session #`ID`. You cannot be in multiple sessions at once.\n\nExample: `join 0`

Help: End your session (creator only)
DetailedHelp: End your session, kicking all players (creator only).

Help: Leave the session you're in
DetailedHelp:
Leave the session you're in.
If you're the creator, you can optionally tell it which player to promote as the new creator. Otherwise, it promotes a random player.

Examples:
`leave`: Leave the session.
`leave User1`: Leave, making User1 the new creator of the session.

Help: Check session info
DetailedHelp: Check the ID, players, and creator of the session you're in.

Help: Check the number of scraps in play
DetailedHelp: Check the number of scraps in the bowl, discard pile, and players' hands.

Help: Add `scrap` to the bowl
DetailedHelp:
Add `scrap` to the bowl. Can add multiple scraps at once: use commas or spaces to separate. You can use quotations marks for phrases with spaces, but don't mix quotations with commas.
There is a maximum of 999 scraps allowed in play, including the discard pile and hands.

Examples:
`add foo`: Add "foo" to the bowl
`add foo bar "baz quz"`: Add "foo", "bar", and "baz quz" to the bowl

Help: Draw `#` scraps from the bowl, or specifically `scrap`
DetailedHelp:
Draw `#` scraps from the bowl, or specifically draw `scrap` from the bowl if present. Can search for and draw multiple scraps at once: use commas or spaces to separate. You can use quotations marks for phrases with spaces, but don't mix quotations with commas.

Examples:
`draw 1`: Draws one scrap from the bowl. (just `draw` automatically draws one scrap as well)
`draw foo`: Draws "foo" from the bowl if present.
"`draw foo bar "baz quz"`: Draws "foo", "bar", and "baz quz" from the bowl.

Help: Draws from discard pile instead
DetailedHelp:
Draw `#` scraps from the discard pile, or specifically draw `scrap` from the bowl if present. Can search for and draw multiple scraps at once: use commas or spaces to separate. You can use quotations marks for phrases with spaces, but don't mix quotations with commas.

Examples:
`drawdiscard 1`: Draws one scrap from the discard pile. (just `drawdiscard` automatically draws one scrap as well)
`drawdiscard foo`: Draws "foo" from the discard pile if present.
"`drawdiscard foo bar "baz quz"`: Draws "foo", "bar", and "baz quz" from the discard pile.

Help: Peek at `#` scraps from the bowl without removing them
DetailedHelp: Peek at `#` scraps from the bowl without removing them.\n\nExample: `peek 3`: Peeks at three scraps in the bowl

Help: Check your hand
DetailedHelp:
Check your hand.
Optionally, do `hand public` to show your hand to the text channel.

Examples:`hand`: Check your hand (bot will DM you the results)
`hand public`: Paste your hand to the text channel

Help: Edit a scrap in your hand
DetailedHelp:
Edit a scrap in your hand, changing it from `old` to `new`.

Example:
`edit foo bar`: Changes the scrap "foo" to "bar"

Help: Play `scrap` from your hand
DetailedHelp:
Plays `scrap` from your hand, moving it to the discard pile. Can play multiple scraps at once: use commas or spaces to separate. You can use quotations marks for phrases with spaces, but don't mix quotations with commas.
You can also play/discard your entire hand with `play hand`.

Examples:
`play foo`: Plays "foo" from your hand
`play foo bar`: Plays both "foo" and "bar"
`play hand`: Plays your entire hand

Help: Destroy `scrap` in your hand
DetailedHelp:
Destroy `scrap` in your hand, removing it from the session. Can destroy multiple scraps at once: use commas or spaces to separate. You can use quotations marks for phrases with spaces, but don't mix quotations with commas.
You can also destroy your entire hand with `destroy hand`.

Examples:
`destroy foo`: Destroys the "foo" scrap
`destroy foo bar "baz quz"`: Destroys "foo", "bar", and "baz quz"
`destroy hand`: Destroys your entire hand

Help: Return `scrap` in your hand to the bowl
DetailedHelp:
Return `scrap` in your hand to the bowl. Can return multiple scraps to the deck at once: use commas or spaces to separate. You can use quotations marks for phrases with spaces, but don't mix quotations with commas.
You can also return your entire hand to the bowl with `return hand`.

Examples:
`return foo`: Returns "foo" to the bowl
`return foo bar`: Returns both "foo" and "bar" to the bowl
`return hand`: Returns your entire hand to the bowl

Help: List all scraps in the bowl or discard pile
DetailedHelp: List all scraps in either the bowl or discard pile.\n\nExampels: `see bowl`, `see discard`

Help: Show your hand to `player`
DetailedHelp:
Show your hand to `player`. Requires confirmation from the other player via a react. You can also do `show public` to show your hand to a public text channel.

Examples:
`show User1`: Shows User1 your hand, DMing them.
`show public`: Pastes your hand to the text channel

Help: Pass `player` `scrap` from your hand, or `#` random ones
DetailedHelp:
Pass `player` `scrap` from your hand. Requires confirmation from the other player via a react. If a number is provided, chooses `#` random scraps instead.
Can pass multiple scraps at once: use commas or spaces to separate. You can use quotations marks for phrases with spaces, but don't mix quotations with commas.

Examples:
`pass User1 foo`: Pass User1 the "foo" scrap
`pass User1 1`: Pass User1 one random scrap

Help: Take `scrap` from `player`'s hand, or `#` random ones
DetailedHelp:
Take `scrap` from `player`'s hand.  Requires confirmation from the other player via a react. If a number is provided, chooses `#` random scraps instead.
Can take multiple scraps at once: use commas or spaces to separate. You can use quotations marks for phrases with spaces, but don't mix quotations with commas.

Examples:
`take User1 foo`: Take the "foo" scrap from User1
`take User1 1`: Take one scrap from User1

Help: Add `scrap` directly to your hand
DetailedHelp:
Add `scrap` directly to your hand. Can add multiple scraps at once: use commas or spaces to separate. You can use quotations marks for phrases with spaces, but don't mix quotations with commas.
There is a maximum of 999 scraps allowed in play, including the discard pile and hands.

Examples:
`addtohand foo`: Add "foo" to your hand
`addtohand foo bar "baz quz"`: Add "foo", "bar", and "baz quz" to your hand

Help: Recall all hands to the bowl (creator only)
DetailedHelp: Recall all hands to the bowl (creator only).

Help: Shuffle the discard pile into the bowl (creator only)
DetailedHelp: Shuffle the discard pile into the bowl (creator only).

Help: Destroy scraps (creator only)
DetailedHelp: Destroy scraps from either the bowl, discard pile, player hands, or all of the above (creator only).

Help: Change the prefix for the server
DetailedHelp:
Changes the prefix for the bot in the current server. Must be a server administrator.
Cannot be used in DMs: must use the default prefix.

Example:`changeprefix $`: Change the prefix of the bot to `$`

Help: Submit a bug report to the dev
DetailedHelp:
Submit a bug report to the dev. The report automatically includes your username.

Example:
`bugreport Draw 2 is broken`: Sends the message "Draw 2 is broken" to the devs.

Help: Bans a user from your session (creator only)
DetailedHelp:
Bans a user from your session (creator only), kicking them if they are already in your session. Accepts multiple users at once.
Bans last until the session is closed. Does not stop the user from joining other sessions.

Examples: `ban User1 User2`: Bans User1 and User2 from the session

Help: Unbans a user from your session (creator only)
DetailedHelp: Unbans a user, removing them from the banlist and allowing them to rejoin your mission. Accepts multiple users at once.\n\nExamples: `unban User1 User2`: Unbans User1 and User2 from the session

Help: Get help for a command or list all commands
DetailedHelp: Returns help for specific commands. Detailed help descriptions may mention alternate aliases or keywords that can be used for the command.
